title: Property Surveyor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanctuary (London, England) in Jul 2023
Interview Descriptions: This company is misleading and job description does not fit role. Much heavier workload than they make out in interview process and lower salary than competitors for work involved. If this company had passion for people they would be more transparent
Interview Questions: What do you know about sanctuary housing

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sanctuary
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the job and then two weeks later I had a interview with two location managers, questions were compentancy based, interview lasted about 45 minutes, then followed by a simple paper test that took 10 minutes to complete.
Interview Questions: Give me a time when you have dealt with a difficult customer, and what did you do?

title: 12-month Rotational Placement With Sanctuary Graduates Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanctuary (London, England) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Interview via telephone about 15 to 20 minutes 
The day-to-day activities of the role or what projects they can expect to participate on
Detail on what the graduate community and company culture is like
Anything which will make the applicants will feel more engaged and connected to the company.
Interview Questions: motivations for the role/ company, followed by some competency-based questions

title: Summer Vacation Scheme Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sanctuary in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a very quick and easy process with nice people. I was successful in the position i applied and interviewed for, and was a straightforward process from there on out.
Interview Questions: What makes you a good candidate for this role

title: Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanctuary (London, England)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty straight forward I first received a phone interview from the recruitment team which was successful then had a interview with the care home manager.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a patient to you they had been giving money to one of the staff

title: Mental Health Support Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sanctuary (Middlesbrough, England) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: You apply online and if you are successful you are invited to an interview where there will be two panel members with a list of about 10 questions.  The panel will ask five questions each between themselves.  The interview was done in a relaxed environment.
Interview Questions: What is your definition of a person at risk?.

title: Bank Healthcare Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sanctuary
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. They took about six weeks to get back to me. Invited for an interview at the home. Interviewed by home manager and senior nurse. Felt very informal and friendly. They guided me to give the right answers. I was incredibly nervous going in as I'd never had an interview before, but it was honestly fine.
Interview Questions: What are important things to consider when taking a meal to a resident?

title: Personal Support Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanctuary (Darlington, North East England, England) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very hectic, interviewed by 3 members off staff felt bombarded with questions. Didn't get a look around the building to get some idea how works and didn't get the chance to greet other staff members.............
Interview Questions: Previous experience

title: Grounds Maintenance Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanctuary in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Online application, relatively easy to complete and then invited to a Competency based interview on skill set, experience you bring to the role, challenges you've encountered in previous roles, customer service experience.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sanctuary
Interview Descriptions: Applied with CV and supporting statement online. Several weeks later was then invited to interview at site.  Several people on the panel, both were friendly and welcoming, quite relaxed process.
Interview Questions: What does compliance mean to you?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sanctuary (London, England) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: skype interview, the panel will introduce themselves, you will introduce your self, the questions will revolve based on your CV/nursing experience, you can ask questions afterwards (ex. regarding patient-nurse ratio, trainings, seminar)
Interview Questions: Tell me something about your nursing experience

title: Support Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Sanctuary (Liverpool, England) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Received an email stating that I'd been successfully shortlisted to attend an interview. I was interviewed by 3 ladies who were wonderful at putting a nervous applicant at ease. Regardless of whether I'm successful or not I appreciate even being considered. All in all looks like an excellent exciting company to work for.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this role?

title: Housing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanctuary (Worcester, England) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview and written test structured interview asking for examples to demonstrate skills. The written test gave scenarios and you had to say how you would deal with that situation and explain your actions
Interview Questions: About experience and skills, give examples of situations

title: Asset Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Sanctuary (Hackney, England) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online and was contacted roughly 3 weeks later by the Asset Manager from the Hackney office. I was invited for an interview 1 week later. 

Attended the interview and from my understanding interview went well. Typical interview questions. A few questions that might throw someone off without the  experience for this particular role. A few situational questions. 

I was told I would be contacted within a week as they were interviewing other candidates. I heard 
nothing for 1 week. I then sent an email to follow up and was ignored. I was not able to get through to any of the interviewers the following week. Line just kept ringing. 

All my emails have been read and ignored. My final attempt was yesterday almost 1 month later after the interview and finally got through to the Asset Manager Who said he will call me back in 30 mins. Guess what...no call back. 

Granted, I didn’t get the role, but at least have the decency to respond and give an update to all interviewees who spent time travelling, taking time of work and preparing for the interview. 

It just shows the professionalism that this company has. They do not bother to get back to you if your not a suitable candidate.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Surveyor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sanctuary in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted by two people, a team manager and an additional senior team member. There was a short introduction conversation which was followed by standard questions. After the interview the job offer came through in a few days.
Interview Questions: Describe your involvement in a project

title: Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sanctuary (London, England) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Asked about experiences and questions designed to explore your questions

Make sure not to leave any gaps on employment history or have character references to fill them as they can greatly slow down the hiring process once a job offer has been received
Interview Questions: Give an example of when you have shown kindness in the work place

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanctuary (London, England) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: \the interview process was good, professional they were kind and helped me a little bit. I was so happy to get this  job; but shortly  realized it is not what i excepted. the supportive staff disappeared and for two days they wanted me to act as  have  full knowledge   for everyhting
Interview Questions: What was my last kindness act

title: Finance Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sanctuary (Worcester, England) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was held by the Manager and her Assistant. The interview was not hard, in addition there were two tests and 30 minutes were given to complete the test. 

However, I had no reply from them at all. I was reassured that every candidate will receive email with offer/no offer. I was waiting for two weeks, so emailed the lady who held the interview, but still no reply at all. I think it is very unprofessional and just has negative impact on the company overall.
Interview Questions: Competency based questions

title: Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Sanctuary (Ipswich, England) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed but I had to do a little 20 minute test. Interviewer very friendly. Interview questions asked and interview lasted about 20 minutes. It was a one to one. The manager and I actually got on really well he made the environment so comfortable.
Interview Questions: What is the role of a care assistant?

title: Customer Service Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanctuary (Banbury, England) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Through an agency, lady was absolutely lovely, bubbly and friendly, talked about the job role,skills I could offer, what the role entails, training process, hours required, background of the company, felt at ease with the interviewer which always makes a big difference as you can be yourself more, talked about what I had done before and how I could use it in the job, was also asked what had I done to go above and beyond for a customer
Interview Questions: What can you bring to the role

title: Surveyor Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Sanctuary (Coventry, England) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Brilliant, one to one formal meeting at hotel in Coventry; relaxed atmosphere with no interruptions. Finding the approach less formal than some other interviews recently which helped the interview more easier.
Interview Questions: How much experience on CDM

title: Deputy Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sanctuary (Banbury, England) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: A three-person panel explain the job and ask predefined questions in turns. Each member gives scores to each answer, though scores may be adjusted to fit the desired outcome. An interviewee is given an opportunity to ask questions at the end.
Interview Questions: With what other organisations does Sanctuary partner?

title: Senior Online Marketing Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sanctuary (Worcester, England) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Via an agency. Agency staff were really helpful in preparation. 
Interviewing staff were professional and enthusiastic about the company.
The offices in Worcester are fantastic, modern, bright. Next door to the University and racecourse so it was possible to use either their on site restaurant or the Uni's refectory or take strolling lunch outside the racecourse by the canal. They also have a small gym for staff or you can join the Uni's.
They were keen to offer ongoing training and development including 'knowledge bursts' at lunch-times.
I would have loved to join the team.
They did not keep me waiting long for a decision and gave positive feedback through the agency (Blue Skies)
Interview Questions: Can you describe a incident of conflict at work and how you managed the situation?

title: Finance Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sanctuary (Worcester, England) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Competency based interview, questions aimed at scenarios, asking  you how you've coped with situations in the past. Include customer service, how you communicate and keep customers up to date. I was over qualified due to my previous job, so I found it really easy.
Interview Questions: If you have two customers with the same deadline, what do you do?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sanctuary (Worcester, England) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: This was a very structured interview, and had an uneasy edge. I had to give a presentation but was given no opportunity to use paper or powerpoint. I was asked about my computer skills
Interview Questions: I was asked how the current scheme compared to schemes they are using at the moment, but there was no way of finding out what they use at the moment because the information was not on their website.

title: Cleaner Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sanctuary (Dundee, Scotland) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very quick, we literally got given a couple of minutes with the interviewer. There were tables lined up, and we were all given numbers and called up to a table to have the interview.
Interview Questions: When have you shown leadership?
